bnf_parser.collectors

Class Collector

  • java.lang.Object
    • bnf_parser.collectors.Collector
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggregationCollector, AssociationCollector, ClassContentCollector, DataitemCollector, DataitemListCollector, GeneralizationCollector, IdentifierListCollector, ModelCollector, OperationCollector, OperationListCollector, RoleCollector, RoleListCollector, StringCollector

    public abstract class Collector
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class is the skeleton of a collector which is called by the parsed to store either strings (via StringCollector) or other collectors (subclassed of Collector) by using the addChild(Collector, int) method. It also allows to define the start and end offsets in the file between which the parser was able to match the current rule.
    Author:
    Hubert Lemelin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int endOffset
      End offset of current Collector corresponding to the position in the file when parsing of the current rule was finished.
      private int startOffset
      Start offset of current Collector corresponding to the position in the file when parsing of the current rule was started.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        public abstract void addChild(Collector collector,
                              int index)
        Called in subclass when a rule/subrule was successfully parsed and returns a certain subclass of Collector. The current (subclass) Collector can decide whether to use it or not.
        Parameters:
        collector - The collector returned by the parser. It might be null.
        index - A custom index defined when creating the current rule to identify more easily a collector, which is particularly useful when many Collector instances are used, and even more useful when some instances are allowed to be missing (minOccurences = 0).

      • setStartOffset

        public void setStartOffset(int startOffset)
        Sets the start offset which is the position in the file where the parsing started.
        Parameters:
        startOffset - The start offset.

      • setEndOffset

        public void setEndOffset(int endOffset)
        Sets the end offset which is the position in the file where the parsing (successfully) ended.
        Parameters:
        endOffset - The end offset.

      • setOffsets

        public void setOffsets(int startOffset,
                       int endOffset)
        Sets both the start offset and the end offset, see setStartOffset(int) and setEndOffset(int).
        Parameters:
        startOffset - The start offset.
        endOffset - The end offset.

      • getStartOffset

        public int getStartOffset()
        Returns the start offset. See setStartOffset(int) and setEndOffset(int).
        Returns:
        The start offset.

      • getEndOffset

        public int getEndOffset()
        Returns the end offset. See setStartOffset(int) and setEndOffset(int).
        Returns:
        The end offset.
